subject: Order JSEXS0376372782YQ missing items
description_text:
Hello, I have received the pedals from this order but the Haptic motors are
missing. I only received a single box. Should I await second shipment with
the Haptic motors or there has been an issue? Please advise what to do next

Thank you!

conversations.body_text: Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,  Due to delays in the surface finishing of the VAM Pro housing, the first batch of orders is expected to begin shipping between June 16th and 18th. International express shipping will be used, ensuring fast delivery.
ID 为 438 的工单已合并到此工单。

合并来自工单438  
      主题: Order: JSEXS0376372782YQ  
      描述:  Hi, I only received the pedals. Haptic motors are missing. Delivery came as single box. Please advice what to do next. Thank you
Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,     The motor has already been shipped. Below is the latest tracking information for your reference.
Thank you for the update. Much appreciated

Hello again, I have received the haptic motors set but there is an issue
with one of the mounting plates. I have the Plus X (which I ordered few
weeks ago) and my throttle and clutch pedal use the narrower frame.
Therefore the wide plate provided with the motors only fits the brake. In
the package I received 2 wide motor plates and 1 thinner plate that mounts
at a 90 degree angle. In the configuration I have received (2 wide and 1
thin plates) I can only install 2 of the three motors. In order to
successfully mount the third motor, I will need another one of the thinner
plates (same as the one clutch plate provided). Only then I will be able to
mount all three motors. In the installation booklet provided, the pedals
are shown to be wide frame on the brake and pedal.

I assume there will be other customers with similar problem, is it possible
to send me just one more narrow clutch plate? This would save us both
resources as the motors are otherwise fully functional. Also for the future
you may need to send an extra narrow clutch mounting plate in case other
customers have similar narrow frame pedals. Thank you in advance!


On Sat, Jun 21, 2025 at 4:39 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi I have received the set of motors but the throttle pedal uses thinner
frame than pictured. One of the provided plates doesn't fit. I could use
the clutch plate to fit the throttle but then I can't mount the clutch
motor... Please advice what to do.

Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,    Is the motor bracket not fitting onto the throttle pedal? You can try loosening the screws on both sides of the throttle pedal arm, then install the motor bracket, and tighten the screws afterward. If I’ve misunderstood the issue, please share a photo so we can better understand and assist you.

The throttle plate doesn't fit the pedal frame because my throttle pedal
seems to be the same width as the clutch. Unlike the instructions booklet,
where the brake and throttle are shown to be the same width.

I've included some pictures of me mounting one of the motors on the
throttle using the clutch plate (you can see by the orientation of the
motor.

To be able to successfully mount all three motors I will need another
clutch mounting plate.

Thank you in advance!

Hi, I have spent past few days tinkering and apart from the mounting issue
(which can be easily resolved with another clutch mounting plate), I have
run into another issue which is brake pedal activation while brake haptic
motor is active. The one on the throttle is fine. I have swapped the spare
motor which I couldn't mount on the clutch to the brake just to eliminate a
motor failure. Same issue occurs with the second motor. I have tried
reducing the gain all the way down to 1% where the motor vibrations are not
perceptible but the same issue occurs. While I'm at 50% brake pressure it
suddenly spikes to 100% precisely on abs activation. I have tried other
effects also on the special Simsonn edition of the Simhub provided by your
Facebook customer relations team.

Please advice what to do next.

Please advice

Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,    Have you downloaded the latest 2.0.8DE version of the software? Please make sure all pedals are properly connected, then unplug and replug the USB. In the software, click the “Offset” button at the top right corner to perform a zero-point calibration. After that, recalibrate the pedals and make sure to set a 5% deadzone for each one.  As for SIMHUB, they have released version 9.9.3, which includes full support for vibration feedback on our pedals. You can download the latest version directly from their official website.         If you're unsure how to proceed, you can download the Todesk tool (no registration required). Once installed, please provide your ID and temporary password, and I’ll assist you remotely.

I checked yesterday and it was 2.08 version on your website. I will try new
Simhub as well.

What are we doing with the mounting plate though? I cannot mount all my
three pedals and I have provided pictures. I need another clutch plate to
be able to mount all three pedals, please help.
Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,    Is your controller a PlusX, ProX, or ProX Ultra?

Hi, my model is Plus X with the VAM Pro haptic motor set of 3.

I have updated to the new Simhub but I can't seem to find any updated
version of the Simsonn Manager. Still 2.0.8 on your website as of now.

Thank you for your support

Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,  Currently, version 2.0.8 supports telemetry for 8 games, and version 2.0.9 will expand support to over 10 mainstream titles. However, SimHub has already released version 9.9.3, which includes compatibility with our pedals, so they are now fully functional in supported games. Also, could you please send photos of the motor and all the brackets you received? I’ll begin arranging the reshipment for you starting tomorrow.

Here are photos of the spare unmounted motor with the bracket. I have
included included photos of the brake and throttle motors already mounted
earlier in the conversation where I am using the clutch plate to mount it
on the throttle at 90 degrees. Can provide more if requested.

Second, I have already updated to 2.0.8 (latest available version on your
website as of this morning), also Simhub is up to date and the title I am
interested in (Lemans Ultimate) is already supported and motors are working
in game. I have given each pedal 10% deadzone but the issue with brake
pedal activation still persists. I have spent the past few days testing
different frequencies and gain levels but it seems that the load cell
itself activates. This means that even if the pedal adjacent to it rumbles,
the brake still activates (usually around 10-20% increase). Which means
during braking then the ABS activated, you get artifacts in the pedal
force, jumping from 50% to 70% for example. Similar thing happens on
traction loss if the throttle vibrates - slight brake activation.

Thank you for your support.

Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,    We apologize for the delayed response — our company has been in the process of relocating to a new address over the past few days, and we may have missed your message.  Regarding your question: is the VAM Pro vibration affecting the motor performance? If the issue is still present, please install the Todesk tool. If prompted to register, simply click the close button in the top-right corner to access the main interface. Then, provide your ID and temporary password, and we’ll arrange a remote session to help you troubleshoot the issue.
Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,  If there’s any issue with the accessories, we can send you a replacement free of charge.

Hi there, I had previously arranged with one of your advisors to get a
clutch plate sent so I can mount all my motors. As you can read earlier in
this thread, I had to use the clutch plate to mount the throttle motor due
to the width of the throttle pedal. (please view photos earlier in the
conversation).

Second, there is brake pedal activation whenever there's a signal to one of
the motors, almost like the load cell itself is picking up the voltage. It
happens even if the gain is at 1% only, so it is not a physical vibration.
Issue persist also when another pedal is being activated (for example when
the TC activated on the throttle pedal, there's brake activation also).
This can also be observed in the Simsonn pedal software.

Thank you for your help.
Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,    You can set a 5% dead zone for each pedal and then test again to see if the issue improves.

I have already done that as I've been simracing for almost 20 years.

The deadzone does help when you're not pressing the pedal. However, when
trail braking, drivers hold the brakes at 20-60% and that is when the issue
is the most annoying. As you're braking with 60%, the ABS kick in and sends
the signal down 70 or even 80%.

A deadzone in this situation will not help. I have been advised to do that
numerous times and it does not fix the issue, just mask it in certain cases
(when you're not pressing the pedal).

Similar thing can be achieved in Simhub by not allowing vibration unless
the pedal is pressed. Still doesn't fix the issue because of the nature of
it.

As mentioned previously, issue persists even at 1% gain, where there's no
vibrations at all.

I'm not sure if this is electrical cross-talk or anything of the sort as it
happens at very low gain levels.

Thanks for your advice.

Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,     I just carefully reviewed all our previous conversations and would like to confirm—are you using a Fanatec or Moza wheelbase? These devices are known to emit EMI (electromagnetic interference) under certain conditions.  Please check the following:    Ensure that the control box and pedals are connected via a green grounding wire, attached to any metal screw on both sides.    Verify that your PC uses a three-prong power plug, which indicates it’s properly grounded through your home’s electrical system.    Once both conditions are met, please refer to the link we provided. It’s an official solution recommended by SIMHUB: Connect the metal housing of your wheelbase to your PC case using a wire. Since your PC is grounded, this creates a path for EMI to discharge safely, helping to prevent interference-related issues.             https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting     https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi, thank you for your communication. I have attached the wire to one of
the screws on the wheel stand. However, I did not think of connecting the
stand to the PC case, since USB cables are already running between the two
but I will try that as well.

On the second issue, what is happening with the clutch plate for the VAM
Pro haptics? I am not sure if I have been speaking to the same person, but
I got notified that I will be sent another clutch plate so I can
successfully attach all three motors, as you can see in the attached
pictures from our previous conversation.

Thank you again for your help and I will try the grounding suggestions.

Hi, I forgot to add that my wheelbase is the Cammus C12 (12 Nm direct drive
axial motor), I often static electric shocks around the house after using
it, so it definitely has some sort of electromagnetic footprint. Thank you
again for the proposal for grounding the wheel stand to the PC case.

Please update me on the motor plate when you can. Thank you!

Hi Ivaylo Grigorov,     If your computer uses a two-prong plug (without a ground pin), grounding will be ineffective. We recommend connecting your computer to a properly grounded three-prong outlet to ensure reliable anti-interference performance.  In practice, after playing for a while, touching metal parts again may cause static discharge — in mild cases, you may feel a small shock; in more serious cases, static buildup in the base can interfere with other USB devices.  Please refer to the grounding instructions below to enhance stability and reduce interference.     Anti-interference Solutions: 1. Ensure your PC is properly grounded through a functional household ground line Some wall outlets only have two wires and lack a ground wire. This not only poses a safety risk but also prevents devices like Fanatec from discharging electromagnetic interference (EMI) effectively. 2. Use a wire to connect the metal housing of your wheel stand or base to the metal case of your PC This creates a shielding path that significantly improves the overall EMI resistance. 3. Connect a green shielded wire from the metal casing of the pedal control box to any metal screw on the pedal This ensures a solid electrical connection between the control box and the pedal to reduce signal drift and noise. 4. Use a USB isolator If interference persists, consider using a USB isolator to further block EMI transmission paths. ⚠ Note: Make sure all connection points are on bare metal surfaces. Painted or oxidized areas can result in poor grounding, reducing the effectiveness of the shielding.

Thank you again.
